page.title: 09FIRE STATION.S.HEDINGHAM.
page.content: On Wednesday May 7th we went to the {Fire Station}which was opened in 1969. It houses an H.C.B. Angus Rescue Pump {Fire Engine.}This engine can carry 400 gallons of water and travel up to 70 m.p.h. It is only five years old. Last year there were 160 fires. The {Leading Fireman}said that the biggest fire that they have attended was at Woolworth's store in Sudbury. They cover an area in North Essex as far as the Suffolk border. The{Fire Station}is 20metres by 10 metres. There is only 1 engine and it is manned by 9{firemen,}they are only part time{firemen.}They are contacted by H.Q. on a 'bleeper'and they have to run to the{station}to get the engine ready. The message about the fire is recorded on a tape recorder and gives instructions obout where the fire is.
